posts.name: Guru
posts.cooked:
STEPS FOLLOWED I have Raspberry Pi 3B on Romi Flashed the latest wpilib romi image from wpilibsuite/WPILibPi ( github.com )]( Releases · wpilibsuite/WPILibPi · GitHub )

Installed photonvision on Romi

The Romi is a small robot that can be controlled with the WPILib software. The main controller is a Raspberry Pi that must be imaged with WPILibPi. Installation: The WPILibPi image includes FRCVisi...

And Edited the RunCamera fille commented out camera server.

Connected PC to ROMI wireless network.

Wpilibpi.local - Loaded and brought up Romi web UI

BUT

photonvision.local:5800 does not load the photonvision UI

I sshed into ROMI again and did netstat not seen port 5800 open. Also pings to photonvision.local failing too please see attached pdf

THANKS A LOT in advance Untitled document (1).pdf (5.4 MB)

link_counts.title: GitHub: Let’s build from here · GitHub

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: Have you tried opening wpilibpi.local:5800 ?

posts.name: Guru
posts.cooked: @ajs2 yes I’ve tried…no luck

posts.name: Mr.R^2
posts.cooked:
I think there may need to be another step not in those directions. Can you ssh into the  Romi and run the following command?

java -jar /path/to/photonvision/photonvision.jar

And then check? What we ended up doing was not removing the cameraserver, but using it to launch Photon. We wrote a Python script that starts photonvision, and then uploaded that through the WPILib interface

Here is a link.

posts.name: Guru
posts.cooked:
Mr.R_2 Thank you…will try and let you know…also I am thinking of cloning your repo and try …will let know ASAP

How did you upload this python? We wrote a Python script that starts photonvision, and then uploaded that through the WPILib interface

posts.name: Mr.R^2
posts.cooked:
You are welcome.

Here are the directions. Do not forget to make the Pi Writeable. I do not think Photon works without that.

FRC Console: The FRC ® image for the Raspberry PI includes a console that can be viewed in any web browser that makes it easy to: Look at the Raspberry PI status, View the status of the background ...

You can also get a printout of errors in the WPILibPi console (Rather than through the shell) that way.

link_counts.title: The Raspberry PI — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Guru
posts.cooked:
SSH is enabled and the default password for the ‘pi’ user has not been changed. This is a security risk - please login as the ‘pi’ user and type ‘passwd’ to set a new password.

Error: Unable to access jarfile /path/to/photonvision/photonvision.j

-bash: cd..: command not found

/
pi@wpilibpi(ro):/ cd psth -bash: cd: psth: No such file or directory pi@wpilibpi(ro) cd path
-bash: cd: path: No such file or directory
pi@wpilibpi(ro):/ ls bin   dev  home  lost+found  mnt  proc  run   service  sys  usr boot  etc  lib   media       opt  root  sbin  srv      tmp  var pi@wpilibpi(ro) cd /path/to/photonvision
-bash: cd: /path/to/photonvision: No such file or directory
pi@wpilibpi(ro):/ cd home pi@wpilibpi(ro):/home$ ls Please see the putty here…I looked at directory structure no photonvision folder ot path folder in  ROMI…very confused

pi pi@wpilibpi(ro):/home$ cd pi pi@wpilibpi(ro):~ ls
examples  install.sh  JJrEP  runCamera  runInteractive  runService  zips
pi@wpilibpi(ro):~ pwd /home/pi pi@wpilibpi(ro):~ java -jar /path/to/photonvision/photonvision.jar
Error: Unable to access jarfile /path/to/photonvision/photonvision.jar

posts.name: Mr.R^2
posts.cooked:
Oh, sorry about that. I forgot to say that in the command, java -jar /path/to/photonvision/photonvision.jar

The java -jar is the command, and the rest is the file location. I would first try to launch it from the folder where photonvision.jar is located.

java -jar photonvision.jar

Then, you can launch it by using the command and replacing java -jar /path/to/photonvision/

with the actual path to your copy of photon. If you are new to shell, the commands cd (change directory) , ls (list files) and ../ (move up one directory) are your friend (I apologize if you already knew them).

posts.cooked: I just cant locate where the jar file located in Romi

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Looking at the install.sh file, it appears to be installed at /opt/photonvision/photonvision.jar

java -jar /path/to/photonvision/photonvision.jar

is used for running Photonvision on a PC. With the Romi, it will actually be running on the Pi that powers the Romi.

If Photonvision doesn’t start when you start the Pi, you should ssh into the Pi and type

sudo service photonvision start

When I tried upgrading my Romi to the latest version of Photonvision, I could not get it to run. I don’t need all the new features so I didn’t spend any time trying to find out if there was a problem with the Romi and the new version or if I was just doing something wrong. I just went back to a version I know worked for me. I am currently using either the Beta 6 or Beta 7 version which you can find here https://github.com/PhotonVision/photonvision/releases

Also…

Can you access your Romi using http://10.0.0.2 ? If so, try accessing Photonvision using http://10.0.0.2:5800

Are you trying to connect to the Romi via a wireless connection or an ethernet cable? When I first installed the software I had issues trying to connect to Photonvision if I was using an ethernet cable, but I can’t recall what those issues were.
